description: Russian tycoons received billions of dollars in dividends as their companies resumed or boosted payouts amid easing economic uncertainty over the Kremlin’s war in Ukraine.
title: Russian Tycoons Pocket $11 Billion Dividends on War Economy Boom

description: Eight months after President Xi Jinping pledged to bring 50,000 US students to China to stabilize ties, Beijing has made its largest outreach yet. For some Americans, the most progress came in surprising moments outside the official program.
title: Xi’s Outreach to Young Americans Stumbles With Scripted Moments

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Josh Wingrove looks at how Joe Biden is responding to calls to step aside from some in his party. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Biden Latest Campaign Challenge Is Quashing a Party Revolt

description: Illinois Governor J.B. Pritzker is stepping up his fight against Donald Trump, with his pro-choice group buying billboard ads in the city that will host the Republican National Convention next week.
title: Pritzker Steps Up Anti-Trump Drive With Milwaukee Abortion Ads

description: Canada will soon share with its allies a “credible, verifiable plan” to boost its military and defense spending by billions of dollars to meet NATO targets, Defense Minister Bill Blair said.
title: Canada to Share Plan for Reaching NATO’s Spending Target, Defense Minister Says

description: A key House Democrat on national security matters called on President Joe Biden to bow out of the presidential race.
title: Key Democrat on National Security Calls on Biden to Quit Race

description: The Pentagon’s top weapons buyer said there are “no excuses” for the 81% projected cost growth of the US’s new intercontinental ballistic missile program, and acknowledged the price tag to American taxpayers could end up even higher.
title: Pentagon Says ‘No Excuses’ for New Intercontinental Missile Program’s Growing Costs

description: President Joe Biden’s top spokeswoman declined to say why a Parkinson’s specialist met multiple times with the White House physician, but stressed that the president was not being treated for that or any other neurological diseases.
title: White House Dodges Questions Over Parkinson’s Doctor, Says Biden Is Fine

description: US Senator Bob Menendez corruptly accepted bribes of gold, cash and a Mercedes Benz for using his power to help businessmen and to serve as a foreign agent of Egypt, a prosecutor told jurors Monday at the end of his two-month trial.
title: Menendez Sold Power of His Office to Aid Businessmen, US Says

description: Former Ukrainian tycoon Gennady Bogolyubov has fled the country to avoid potential prosecution related to a criminal probe, Ukrayinska Pravda reported on Monday.
title: Former Privatbank Co-Owner Bogolyubov Flees Ukraine, Report Says

description: They pride themselves on being doers; taking decisive action at crucial inflection points and anticipating major power shifts.
title: Biden’s Biggest Donors Left Powerless to Sway Him to Quit Race

description: The Justice Department is interviewing survivors and families of victims of Hamas’ Oct. 7 attack in Israel as it attempts to build a sweeping case against the terrorist group and its financial backers.
title: US Interviews Hamas Hostage Victims, Families in Terror Probe

description: A Republican party committee approved a 2024 platform ahead of next week’s convention that details priorities for presumptive nominee Donald Trump’s potential second-term agenda, including addressing the migrant border crisis, cutting taxes and boosting domestic energy production.
title: RNC Platform Approved by Panel Highlights Tax Cuts, Border

description: Ivory Coast’s ruling party is mobilizing support for President Alassane Ouattara to seek a controversial fourth term in office.
title: Ivory Coast’s Ruling Party Paves Way for President to Seek Fourth Term

description: Poland and Moldova are looking for ways to help Ukraine boost its electricity security amid a barrage of recent Russian attacks on power facilities.
title: Poland and Moldova Seek to Help Ukraine Boost Power Security

description: The US Treasury Department will expand its scrutiny of foreign investments near military bases to counter suspected security threats from China and other countries.
title: US to Expand Scrutiny of Foreign Investments Near Military Bases

description: NATO is helping finance a project aimed at finding ways to keep the internet running should subsea cables shuttling civilian and military communications across European waters come under attack.
title: NATO Backs Effort to Save Internet by Rerouting to Space in Event of Subsea Attacks

description: Cameroon’s parliament started deliberating a bill that aims to extend lawmakers’ mandates by a year, a move that may technically wipe out any opposition in the 2025 presidential election.
title: Cameroon’s Biya to Extend MP Mandates, Quash Opposition in Vote

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s recent trips to Moscow and Beijing had one thing in common: they blindsided his country’s Western allies.
title: Orban’s Shuttle Diplomacy Angers Europe and Whiplashes Allies

description: As Labour starts its first full week in government, here’s a rundown on f the latest developments and what’s to come.
title: Labour’s First Steps After Winning a Landslide: The Readout

description: A Kenyan court blocked President William Ruto’s plan to carry out a forensic audit of the nation’s public debt, after two petitioners challenged the plan as unconstitutional.
title: Kenya High Court Stops Ruto Forensic Audit of Public Debt Panel

description: France’s political class is drawing breath after a turbulent parliamentary election as officials prepare to begin in earnest negotiations over the next government.
title: France Takes Uncharted Path as Snap Election Delivers Deadlock

description: A debriefing on the result featuring Jean-Claude Trichet and Voternomics host Stephanie Flanders
title: Transcript: French Election Shows Country Divided, Trichet Says

description: Global politics and the future of US President Joe Biden will be top of mind when business leaders gather at the Sun Valley Conference this week.
title: Media, Tech Titans Head to Sun Valley With Biden Future in Doubt

description: A proposed retail offering of government-held shares in NatWest Group Plc is looking less likely following the change of power in Britain.
title: NatWest Retail Stock Offering Seen In Doubt After Labour Win

description: Stellantis NV’s Italy-based car production dropped 36% in the first half, as a delay in electric-vehicle subsidies promised by the government exacerbated a slowdown in the demand for electric vehicles.
title: Stellantis Italy Car Production Slumps in Government Setback

description: The Indian government rejected a Citigroup report claiming that the country will struggle to create enough jobs even if the economy grows at 7% annually.
title: India Refutes Citigroup’s Employment Report Alleging Data Gaps

description: President Joe Biden pledged to fellow Democrats he will remain in the 2024 presidential race, seeking to quell an intraparty revolt against his campaign.
title: Biden Tells Lawmakers He’s Running, Time to End Talk of Swap

description: The UK’s new Chancellor of the Exchequer said she has no plans to change the way interest is paid on the Bank of England’s reserves, amid growing scrutiny of the losses the central bank’s crisis-era bond buying program incurs for the government.
title: UK Chancellor Has No Plans to Change Interest on BOE Reserves

description: Russia and India are likely to agree on a long-term uranium supply pact for a nuclear power plant coming online in the southern state of Tamil Nadu, said senior officials with knowledge of the matter.
title: India Poised to Secure Long-Term Uranium Supply From Russia

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s nascent European Union alliance got a boost of influence Monday, with two major far—right parties — led by France’s Marine Le Pen and Italy’s Matteo Salvini — planning to join it.
title: Le Pen, Salvini to Join Orban’s New Far-Right EU Alliance

description: The former ECB president joins a special edition of Voternomics on the French election results.
title: French Election Result Shows Country Divided, Trichet Says

description: A fourth-generation heir to the Dassault fighter-jet fortune was among the political casualties of France’s legislative elections, losing a seat that was held by the family for more than half a century.
title: Billionaire Dassault Clan’s Political Legacy Ends With 31-Year-Old Heir’s Defeat

description: Moldova’s pro-Russia Socialist opposition unexpectedly backed a controversial former top prosecutor as its candidate in this year’s presidential election as the current administration charts a path toward the European Union.
title: Moldova’s Pro-Russia Socialists Back Ex-Prosecutor for President

description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves vowed to “get Britain building again,” as she unveiled a slew of planning reforms including restoring mandatory local housing targets ditched by the previous Conservative government and ending an effective ban on onshore wind farms.
title: UK Chancellor Reeves Vows to Fix Broken Planning System for Housebuilding

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy met with Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk in Warsaw to sign a long-term security agreement as part of Poland’s support for the war-torn nation.
title: Poland and Ukraine Sign Security Deal Ahead of NATO Summit

description: The Labour government will change the approval process for onshore wind projects, clawing back power from local bodies to try and speed up building, Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said.
title: Labour Claws Back Approval for Onshore Wind to Speed Up Building

description: Jurors in the corruption trial of Senator Bob Menendez held the gold bars stashed in his house, read romantic messages from his wife amid their tumultuous relationship, and heard government witnesses recount how his entreaties alarmed them.
title: Bob Menendez Jurors Held Gold Bars, Saw Secret Video, Eyed Cash

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: A Reformist Heart Surgeon Confronts Iran’s Ultra-Conservatives

description: New UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer will this week launch Great British Energy, a public company designed to spur investment in clean energy, and convene a business task force to advise on the creation of a national wealth fund, as his government looks to show it is getting off on the front foot.
title: Starmer to Launch GB Energy, Investors’ Task Force This Week

description: Brazil’s most populous state is about to sell a strategic stake in Latin America’s largest water utility to a $7 billion energy distributor that only got its start in sanitation two years ago.
title: An Energy Company Is About to Manage Water for 28 Million Brazilians

description: About this time last year, voters didn’t know the name Doug Burgum. Just to get on a debate stage with other Republican presidential primary contenders, he had to give out $20 gift cards in return for $1 campaign donations.
title: Doug Burgum Charms Trump and Donors to Emerge as VP Contender

description: Developed nations such as the US need to invest in countries with vast reserves of critical minerals to reduce supply chain risks as these commodities are “the new oil” driving geopolitics, according to Indonesia’s Deputy Foreign Minister Pahala Mansury.
title: Indonesia Says US Must Invest as Critical Minerals Race Picks Up

description: The International Monetary Fund is set to discuss a review of the fees it charges its biggest borrowers after some nations raised concerns that costs are becoming unreasonable due to higher interest rates.
title: IMF to Discuss Options for Lowering Penalties on Big Borrowers

description: Hungary’s government announced plans to plug gaps in its budget by introducing new taxes on banks and not lowering windfall levies on industries as formerly promised.
title: Hungary Raises Windfall Taxes on Banks to Plug Budget Deficit

description: Myanmar’s military regime is at risk of losing economic hubs in the northeast and along the west coast as resistance forces say they are taking over major towns after a China-brokered cease-fire collapsed last month.
title: Myanmar Junta Risks Losing Gem, Tourist Hubs to Armed Groups

description: West African leaders tasked Senegalese President Bassirou Diomaye Faye with trying to convince the military leaders of three nations not to withdraw from the regional economic bloc.
title: Senegal Leader Handed Tough Task to Keep Juntas in Regional Bloc

description: Discussions among leaders of NATO countries at their summit in Washington on July 9-11 are likely to be colored by what’s at stake for the alliance in November’s US presidential election. Donald Trump, the Republican candidate, raised alarms about his commitment to NATO when he was president from 2017 to 2021. More recently, he’s suggested he would not in all cases honor Article 5 of NATO’s founding treaty, the obligation of members to come to each other’s aid.
title: Why NATO Allies Are Worried About a Second Trump Presidency

description: The Ukrainian capital came under attack on Monday as part of an assault across the country, with the nation’s air force reporting that Kinzhal missiles had been deployed from Russia.
title: Kyiv Comes Under Attack in Missile Strike Across Ukraine

description: The outcome of France’s snap parliamentary vote is reassuring, though its repercussions are likely to test both domestic politics and the wider region, according to German Economy Minister Robert Habeck.
title: French Result Encouraging But Represents Challenge, Habeck Says

description: French stocks dipped as a surprise victory for the left-wing alliance triggered worries that the higher likelihood of further fiscal easing means it would put pressure on the country’s already-strained finances.
title: French Equities Dip After Surprise Election Win for Left

description: Russia’s Federal Security Service said it foiled an attempt by Ukraine to recruit a pilot willing to defect with a supersonic strategic bomber jet.
title: Russia Says It Foiled Ukrainian Plot to Hijack Strategic Bomber

description: France is heading into an extended period of political gridlock after a shock defeat for Marine Le Pen’s far right in Sunday’s elections produced a divided parliament with no clear majority.
title: France Dodges Far-Right Win But Macron Has No One Who Can Govern

description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — South Korea said Monday it’ll withdraw its earlier plan to suspend licenses of striking doctors as part of its efforts to resolve the country’s months-long medical impasse.
title: South Korea Withdraws Plan to Suspend Licenses of Striking Doctors

description: The Labour leader should be planning for 10 years in power, not just five.
title: Keir Starmer, No. 10’s Ringo Starr, Needs a Two-Album Deal

description: Taiwan’s central bank governor was prevented from appearing in the legislature because lawmakers got into shoving matches over a bill put forward by the opposition.
title: Tussles in Taiwan Legislature Delay Central Banker’s Appearance

description: Bangladesh is likely to sign 20 accords with China and start new projects on July 10 during Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina’s visit to Beijing, the foreign ministry in Dhaka said in a statement.
title: Bangladesh to Sign 20 Accords With China, Start New Projects

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban will meet China’s leader in Beijing, a trip that comes after his controversial sitdown with Vladimir Putin.
title: Hungary’s Orban Visits China Fresh Off Meeting With Putin
